instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00426: What is 820-00426? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Boot after logic board removal and re-installation.
threads.message: Hello. I have a 2015 15" MacBook Pro here that all of a sudden fails to chime or display an image following removal of the logic board and thermal re-grease. Its an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Board. I tested this unit fully before disassembly and it ran perfect and passed all diagnostic tests. There is ZERO liquid damage on this board. It now turns on to only fans spinning at normal speed, no chime, and I can feel the CPU getting very warm. Could this be a case of a failed CPU? Its pulling 1AMP off the charger, and is still charging battery when battery connected. Where do I go from here?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Boot after logic board removal and re-installation.
threads.message:
Possibly knocked off components, or broken traces.
Did you check USB activity?
Test the board alone on the desk.
Keep connected only charger and USB tester.
Be sure to use original 85W Magsafe 2 charger.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Boot after logic board removal and re-installation.
threads.message: I came in this morning and attempted to power up again. It fired right up and is now working normally. Lets just hope it stays that way
